Animation.summary: The Animation interface of the Web Animations API represents a single animation player and provides playback controls and a timeline for an animation node or source.

remarks.para: -Web Animations API

AnimationAnimation.summary: The Animation() constructor of the Web Animations API returns a new Animation object instance.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-

AnimationCancel.summary: The Web Animations API's cancel() method of the interface clears all s caused by this animation and aborts its playback.

blockquote.para: When an animation is cancelled, its and are set to null.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-
-
-
- returns the promise this action will reject if the animation's playState is not "idle".

AnimationCancel.summary: The cancel event of the interface is fired when the method is called or when the animation enters the "idle" play state from another state, such as when the animation is removed from an element before it finishes playing.

blockquote.para: Creating a new animation that is initially idle does not trigger a cancel event on the new animation.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-

AnimationCommitStyles.summary: The commitStyles() method of the Web Animations API's interface writes the computed values of the animation's current styles into its target element's style attribute.

remarks.para: It is primarily used to write the styles for the final state of an animation into the target element, so that the styling persists after the animation ends.

-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.

AnimationCurrentTime.summary: The Animation.currentTime property of the Web Animations API returns and sets the current time value of the animation in milliseconds, whether running or paused.

remarks.para: If the animation lacks a , is inactive, or hasn't been played yet, currentTime's return value is null.

- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
- for the time an animation is scheduled to start.
-Web Animations API

AnimationCurrentTime.value: A number representing the current time in milliseconds, or null to deactivate the animation.

AnimationEffect.summary: The Animation.effect property of the Web Animations API gets and sets the target effect of an animation. The target effect may be either an effect object of a type based on , such as , or null.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-
-

AnimationEffect.value: An object describing the target animation effect for the animation, or null to indicate no active effect.

AnimationFinish.summary: The finish() method of the Web Animations API's Interface sets the current playback time to the end of the animation corresponding to the current playback direction.

remarks.para: That is, if the animation is playing forward, it sets the playback time to the length of the animation sequence, and if the animation is playing in reverse (having had its method called), it sets the playback time to 0.

-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
- to play an animation forward.
- to play an animation backward.

AnimationFinished.summary: The Animation.finished read-only property of the Web Animations API returns a which resolves once the animation has finished playing.

blockquote.para: Every time the animation leaves the finished play state (that is, when it starts playing again), a new Promise is created for this property. The new Promise will resolve once the new animation sequence has completed.

remarks.para:
-
-Web Animations API
-

AnimationFinished.value: A object which will resolve once the animation has finished running.

AnimationFinish.summary:
The finish event of the interface is fired when the animation finishes playing, either when the animation completes naturally, or
when the method is called to immediately cause the
animation to finish up.

blockquote.para:
The "paused" play state supersedes the "finished" play
state; if the animation is both paused and finished, the "paused" state
is the one that will be reported. You can force the animation into the
"finished" state by setting its to
document.timeline.currentTime - (Animation.currentTime * Animation.playbackRate).

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-
-

AnimationId.summary: The Animation.id property of the Web Animations API returns or sets a string used to identify the animation.

remarks.para:
-
-Web Animations API
-

AnimationId.value: A string which can be used to identify the animation, or null if the animation has no id.

AnimationOverallProgress.summary: The overallProgress read-only property of the interface returns a number between 0 and 1 indicating the animation's overall progress towards its finished state. This is the overall progress across all of the animation's iterations, not each individual iteration.

remarks.para: overallProgress works consistently across all animations, regardless of the type of .

- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
-Web Animations API

AnimationOverallProgress.value: A number between 0 and 1, or null if the animation lacks a timeline, is inactive or hasn't been played yet, or if its is set to a non-time value.If the animation's iterations property is set to Infinity, or if its is set to a negative value, overallProgress will return 0.If the animation's duration is set to 0, overallProgress will return 1.

AnimationPause.summary: The pause() method of the Web Animations API's interface suspends playback of the animation.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
- to play an animation backwards.
- to finish an animation.
- to cancel an animation.

AnimationPending.summary: The read-only Animation.pending property of the Web Animations API indicates whether the animation is currently waiting for an asynchronous operation such as initiating playback or pausing a running animation.

remarks.para:
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
-Web Animations API

AnimationPending.value: true if the animation is pending, false otherwise.

AnimationPersist.summary: The persist() method of the Web Animations API's interface explicitly persists an animation, preventing it from being automatically removed when it is replaced by another animation.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
-
- event

AnimationPlay.summary: The play() method of the Web Animations API's Interface starts or resumes playing of an animation. If the animation is finished, calling play() restarts the animation, playing it from the beginning.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
- to pause an animation.
- to play an animation backwards.
- to finish an animation.
- to cancel an animation.

AnimationPlaybackRate.summary: The Animation.playbackRate property of the Web Animations API returns or sets the playback rate of the animation.

remarks.para: Animations have a playback rate that provides a scaling factor from the rate of change of the animation's time values to the animation's current time. The playback rate is initially 1.

-Web Animations API
-

AnimationPlaybackRate.value:
Takes a number that can be 0, negative, or positive. Negative values reverse the animation. The value is a scaling factor, so for example a value of 2 would double the playback rate.
NOTESetting an animation's playbackRate to 0 effectively pauses the animation (however, its does not necessarily become paused).

AnimationPlayState.summary: The read-only Animation.playState property of the Web Animations API returns an enumerated value describing the playback state of an animation.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.

AnimationPlayState.value: Previously, Web Animations defined a pending value to indicate that some asynchronous operation such as initiating playback was yet to complete. This is now indicated by the separate property.

AnimationReady.summary: The read-only Animation.ready property of the Web Animations API returns a which resolves when the animation is ready to play. A new promise is created every time the animation enters the "pending" play state as well as when the animation is canceled, since in both of those scenarios, the animation is ready to be started again.

blockquote.para: Since the same is used for both pending play and pending pause requests, authors are advised to check the state of the animation when the promise is resolved.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-
-

AnimationReady.value: A which resolves when the animation is ready to be played. You'll typically use a construct similar to this when using the ready promise:

AnimationRemove.summary: The remove event of the interface fires when the animation is automatically removed by the browser.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-,
-, to check whether an animation has been removed
-, to prevent removal of an animation

AnimationReplaceState.summary: The read-only Animation.replaceState property of the Web Animations API indicates whether the animation has been removed by the browser automatically after being replaced by another animation.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-
- event
-

AnimationReplaceState.value: A string that represents the replace state of the animation. The value can be one of:

AnimationReverse.summary: The Animation.reverse() method of the Interface reverses the playback direction, meaning the animation ends at its beginning. If called on an unplayed animation, the whole animation is played backwards. If called on a paused animation, the animation will continue in reverse.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
- for other methods and properties you can use to control web page animation.
- to pause an animation.
- to move an animation forward.

AnimationStartTime.summary: The Animation.startTime property of the interface is a double-precision floating-point value which indicates the scheduled time when an animation's playback should begin.

remarks.para: An animation's start time is the time value of its when its target is scheduled to begin playback. An animation's start time is initially unresolved (meaning that it's null because it has no value).

-Web Animations API
-
- for the current time of the animation.

AnimationStartTime.value: A floating-point number representing the current time in milliseconds, or null if no time is set. You can read this value to determine what the start time is currently set at, and you can change this value to make the animation start at a different time.

AnimationTimeline.summary: The Animation.timeline property of the interface returns or sets the associated with this animation. A timeline is a source of time values for synchronization purposes, and is an -based object. By default, the animation's timeline and the 's timeline are the same.

remarks.para:
-Web Animations API
-
- the parent object all timelines inherit from.
- the only kind of timeline object available at this time.
- is the default timeline all animations are assigned.

AnimationTimeline.value: A {{domxref("AnimationTimeline", "timeline object", "", 1)}} to use as the timing source for the animation, or null to use the default, which is the 's timeline.

AnimationUpdatePlaybackRate.summary:
The updatePlaybackRate() method of the Web Animations API's
Interface sets the speed of an animation after first
synchronizing its playback position.

remarks.para:
In some cases, an animation may run on a separate thread or process and will continue
updating even while long-running JavaScript delays the main thread. In such a case,
setting the on the animation
directly may cause the animation's playback position to jump since its playback
position on the main thread may have drifted from the playback position where it is
currently running.

updatePlaybackRate() is an asynchronous method that sets the speed of an
animation after synchronizing with its current playback position, ensuring that the
resulting change in speed does not produce a sharp jump. After calling
updatePlaybackRate() the animation's is not immediately updated.
It will be updated once the animation's promise is resolved.

-Web Animations API
- — read back the current playback rate or set
it in a synchronous manner.
- — invert the playback rate and restart playback
if necessary.
- — contains other methods and properties you can use to
control web page animation.
